page.title: 01HOUSING IN THE STUDY AREA
page.content: { Housing in and around Horrabridge is fairly mixed.Old houses are not very often demolished but redecorated inside.Near the centre of{Horrabridge the houses are the oldest,the public houses and shops are here also.The further up the side of the valley you go,the more modern the houses.All the houses are built in roughly the same way.Most have cavity walls and an "A" frame holding up the roof;some old houses do not have a cavity,relying on thick walls for insulation.The roof is built of tiles made of asbestos,slate or concrete.The{farmhouses}outside Horrabridge are fairly old.Sortridge Manor is very old and can be traced from 1500 . The{school}has slate tiles and is partly made from granite.
